api_contracts.description: Returns a simple greeting message with HTTP 200 status code

error_responses.message: An unexpected error occurred while processing the request

component_logic.responsibility: Initializes and configures the HTTP server framework with routing infrastructure

interfaces.description: Create and return a configured FastAPI application instance
Register all route handlers with the FastAPI application
Start the HTTP server on specified host and port

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use FastAPI 0.104+ framework for HTTP server. Initialize with default settings. Configure CORS if needed (allow all origins for development). Use uvicorn as ASGI server with host='0.0.0.0' and port=8000 by default. Implement graceful shutdown handling. Log server startup and shutdown events.

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns serialized JSON response with greeting message

interfaces.description: Handle GET /hello request and return greeting message as JSON
Serialize message into JSON response structure

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement as FastAPI route handler decorated with @app.get('/hello'). Return dictionary with key 'message' and value 'Hello World'. FastAPI automatically serializes to JSON with Content-Type: application/json. Use Response model with Pydantic for type safety. No query parameters or request body required. Always return HTTP 200 status code on success.

component_logic.responsibility: Implements error handling and HTTP status code responses for the hello endpoint

interfaces.description: Handle unexpected exceptions and return 500 error response
Format error response with status code, error code, and message

component_logic.implementation_notes: Implement global exception handler using FastAPI @app.exception_handler(Exception). Catch all unhandled exceptions and return JSON response with status 500. Log exception details (stack trace, timestamp) for debugging. Return error response with structure: {"error_code": "INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR", "message": "An unexpected error occurred while processing the request"}. Use try-except blocks in route handler to catch any runtime errors. Validate request method is GET (FastAPI handles this automatically). Return appropriate HTTP status codes: 200 for success, 500 for server errors.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify HTTP server framework is properly initialized and routes are registered
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HTTPServerFramework.initialize_app() must return a valid FastAPI instance. HTTPServerFramework.configure_routes() must register HelloRouteHandler.hello() as GET /hello endpoint. Server must start without errors on port 8000.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify all exceptions are caught and return proper HTTP error responses
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Unhandled exceptions must be caught by global exception handler. Response must include status 500, error_code 'INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR', and descriptive message. No stack traces exposed to client.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify GET /hello endpoint returns correct response structure
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: GET /hello must return JSON with structure {"message": "Hello World"}. Content-Type header must be application/json. HTTP status code must be 200.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify request validation prevents malformed requests
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Only GET requests to /hello are accepted. POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH to /hello must return 405 Method Not Allowed. Invalid request methods must be rejected by framework.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify server startup and request handling are efficient
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Server must start within 5 seconds. GET /hello must respond within 100ms. No blocking operations in request handler. Use async/await pattern if needed.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component dependencies are correctly wired
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloRouteHandler must depend on HTTPServerFramework. ErrorHandler must depend on both HTTPServerFramework and HelloRouteHandler. No circular dependencies exist.

architecture_overview: Simple three-tier architecture with HTTPServerFramework providing the foundational HTTP server infrastructure using FastAPI, HelloRouteHandler implementing the GET /hello endpoint with JSON response serialization, and ErrorHandler providing global exception handling and error response formatting. The framework initializes the server, registers routes, and starts listening on port 8000. All requests to /hello return a JSON response with the message 'Hello World'. Any unhandled exceptions are caught by the global error handler and returned as HTTP 500 responses with appropriate error codes and messages.
assumptions: Server runs on localhost:8000 by default (host 0.0.0.0, port 8000)
HTTPS/TLS is not required for this simple endpoint (can be added at infrastructure level)
No authentication or authorization is required for the /hello endpoint
Request body is not expected or processed for GET /hello
Response is always JSON format with Content-Type: application/json
Server gracefully handles shutdown signals (SIGTERM, SIGINT)
Logging is configured to output to stdout/stderr for container environments
No database or external service dependencies are required
